boat.name: Polly Garter
boat.full_description:
Polly Garter's first owner collected her new from Cornish Crabbers in 1978 where she was launched. After a week in the Camel learning about topsails, she was sailed to Mumbles in S Wales, then on to Barry, Portishead and up the Severn Estuary with the odd 10 knots under her and into the lock  at Sharpness. Carrying on up to Worcester and into the River Avon 'Polly Garter' settled into her smooring. Being too big for the river, really, with the mooring above the bridge over the M5, meant half lowering the mast for each trip down to Tewkesbury, to get under the M5! All good fun and her owner was very sad to sell here to a new owner at Milford Haven.

Why is she called 'Polly Garter'? She was named by her first owner after Polly Garter, the woman of loose morals in Dylan Thomas's Under Milkwood, a play he loved and could quote all sorts of passages from.
boat.short_description: Named after a 'loose woman' in a play by Dylan Thomas, 'Polly Garter' is a Cornish Crabber Mark 1, launched in 1978.
